name: Lia Fail
shortDescription: Stone of Destiny that roars when touched by the rightful High King of Ireland
fullDescription: The Lia Fail (Irish: Stone of Destiny) is one of the Four Treasures of the Tuatha De Danann, brought from the mystical city of Falias. This sacred coronation stone was placed on the Hill of Tara and possessed the power to cry out under the feet of the rightful High King of Ireland. It served as the ultimate test of sovereignty and divine right to rule.

mythologyContexts.usage: Central element in the coronation ceremony of Irish High Kings. The stone's acknowledgment confirmed divine approval and the king's connection to the land and sovereignty goddess

textReferences.context: Lists the Lia Fail as one of the Four Treasures from the city of Falias
Describes the stone's function in kingship rituals

mythologyContexts.symbolism: Represents the sacred bond between king and land in Celtic tradition. The stone's voice symbolizes the land itself choosing its rightful ruler. Embodies the concept that sovereignty is divinely sanctioned and requires the consent of the earth and the goddess of the land.
mythologyContexts.culturalSignificance: The Lia Fail remains one of Ireland's most potent symbols of national identity and rightful rulership. A stone identified as the Lia Fail still stands on the Hill of Tara, though debate continues about its authenticity. The concept influenced the Stone of Scone used in Scottish and English coronations.
